roleset.name: make longer
roleset.note: LENGTHEN-V NOTES: Look at other examples of the class for additional examples of usage. (from lengthen.01-v)

example.name: ergative, with EXT and end point
example.text: Average maturity of the funds' investments lengthened by a day to 41 days, the longest since early August, according to Donoghue's.
example.arg: Average maturity of the funds' investments
to 41 days, the longest since early August,

example.name: agentive
example.text: Mr. Ireland said current demand for used aircraft is strong, partly because surging orders for new aircraft have lengthened waiting lists.

roleset.name: want, desire
roleset.note: LONG-V NOTES: Frames file for 'long' based on sentences in wsj. No access to Verbnet at the moment. (from long.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: wrong syntactic parse
example.text: Still, they long for a ``mega-hit'' toy to excite retail sales in the U.S., Hong Kong's biggest market for toys and games.
example.arg: for a ``mega-hit'' toy to excite retail sales in the U.S., Hong Kong's biggest market for toys and games

roleset.name: having a great length measurement
roleset.note: LONG-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1. Related to lengthen-v.01, elongate-v.01, prolong-v.01. (from long.01-j)

example.name: arg1, EXT
example.text: The rest of your OP was just too damned long .

example.name: both args
example.text: The shark was 12 feet long, 8 feet in girth and weighs more than 1300 pounds, according to the fishermen's estimates.
